definition: to run up (pole vault, javelin, bowling etc)/approach/run-up/(aviation) takeoff run
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off

sentences.english: Tom ran up and delivered the ball perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆先助跑，然后投球投得非常好。

sentences.english: This is beyond the run-up line of the self.
sentences.chinese: 这就是超越自我的助跑线。

sentences.english: The speed of approach of the long-jump is closely related to the achievement.
sentences.chinese: 跳远的助跑速度与跳远成绩密切相关。

sentences.english: Hadlee is now running up to bowl.
The slowness and quickness of the run-up in long-jump mainly depends on the utilization rate of speed.
sentences.chinese: 跳远助跑的快慢较大程度取决于速度利用率的大小。

sentences.english: That is, to improve run-up speed, greater kinetic energy.
sentences.chinese: 也就是提高助跑速度，获得更大的动能。

sentences.english: We take a short run and jump with all our might.
sentences.chinese: 我们助跑了一小段后就用尽全力往前跳。

sentences.english: How does the jumper measure his approach run?
sentences.chinese: 跳远的关键技术是助跑。

sentences.english: The most critical part is the run-up.
sentences.chinese: 跳远的关键技术是助跑。

definition: ten-pin bowling/bowling ball/(baseball etc) ground ball
to hop/to jump on one leg
to slide/to coast/to glide/(of an aircraft) to taxi
to start running/the start of a race
